summary: The Fiscal Contingency Preparedness Act (S.2492) mandates the Secretary of the Treasury, in coordination with the Office of Management and Budget, to assess the federal government's ability to respond to fiscal shocks like economic recessions, natural disasters, and health crises. It requires an annual report detailing potential fiscal risks and impacts, including short-term and long-term effects. The bill also calls for a Government Accountability Office (GAO) review of the Treasury assessment's methodology and results.
